message.content:
We need to “extract” only the sales (the “Sale”‐type transactions) and then add together the “after_tax_amount” amounts in those rows (i.e. the “net sales” part). In our data the row headers are:

• id  
• type  
• date  
• recorded_date  
• amount  
• recorded_amount  
• approver  
• preparer  
• payment/receipt_status  
• payment_method  
• cost_per_unit  
• supplier_id  
• supplier_name  
• product_id  
• product_name  
• quantity  
• unit_price  
• receive_method  
• customer_id  
• tax_amount  
• after_tax_amount  
• cost_amount  
• profit  
• asset_name  
• asset_type

Because the “after_tax_amount” in a sale is considered the net sales revenue actually realized, it is considered the “main business revenue.”

Below we go row–by–row (only for rows whose type equals “Sale”) and list the “after_tax_amount” value (all numbers are taken from the sixth “data‐columns” of each sale row):

1. Sale20240102003 – after_tax_amount = 53,273.93  
2. Sale20240102004 – after_tax_amount = 183,485.51  
3. Sale20240103006 – after_tax_amount = 99,721.35  
4. Sale20240103007 – after_tax_amount = 131,478.91

15. Sale20240109021 – after_tax_amount = 57,003.90

19. Sale20240113027 – after_tax_amount = 36,700.56

22. Sale20240115031 – after_tax_amount = 42,640.33

24. Sale20240116034 – after_tax_amount = 77,176.12  
25. Sale20240117035 – after_tax_amount = 106,371.46  
26. Sale20240117036 – after_tax_amount = 510,616.56  
27. Sale20240118038 – after_tax_amount = 53,511.46  
28. Sale20240118039 – after_tax_amount = 313,111.54  
29. Sale20240119041 – after_tax_amount = 42,363.05  
30. Sale20240120042 – after_tax_amount = 23,649.21  
31. Sale20240120043 – after_tax_amount = 56,707.39  
32. Sale20240121044 – after_tax_amount = 11,134.90

35. Sale20240123048 – after_tax_amount = 285,572.42

37. Sale20240126054 – after_tax_amount = 427,099.44  
38. Sale20240127055 – after_tax_amount = 183,551.11

41. Sale20240130056 – after_tax_amount = 121,865.14  
42. Sale20240130057 – after_tax_amount = 70,585.24

Now we add all these values. (It may help to add sequentially:)

• 53,273.93  
+ 183,485.51 = 236,759.44  
+ 99,721.35 = 336,480.79  
+ 131,478.91 = 467,959.70  
+ 46,356.35 = 514,316.05  
+ 249,166.72 = 763,482.77  
+ 20,970.47 = 784,453.24  
+ 64,607.82 = 849,061.06  
+ 162,397.16 = 1,011,458.22  
+ 196,387.40 = 1,207,845.62

+ 279,366.07 = 1,536,299.27  
+ 24,724.38 = 1,561,023.65

+ 106,371.46 = 3,164,031.68

+ 313,111.54 = 4,041,271.24  
+ 42,363.05 = 4,083,634.29

+ 56,707.39 = 4,163,990.89  
+ 11,134.90 = 4,175,125.79

+ 94,838.12 = 4,830,201.57  
+ 285,572.42 = 5,115,773.99  
+ 45,338.05 = 5,161,112.04  
+ 427,099.44 = 5,588,211.48  
+ 183,551.11 = 5,771,762.59  
+ 104,809.22 = 5,876,571.81  
+ 128,099.80 = 6,004,671.61  
+ 121,865.14 = 6,126,536.75  
+ 70,585.24 = 6,197,121.99

Thus the sum of the after_tax_amount for all Sales is 6,197,121.99.

This is the “Main Business Revenue” for the income statement.

So our final solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Main Business Revenue": "6197121.99"
  }
}
